title: Hawking Temperature and the Inverse-Radius Scale of the Horizon
authors: Michael R.R. Good, Yen Chin Ong
abstract:
The Hawking temperature of a Schwarzschild black hole can be heuristically
derived by identifying the temperature with the inverse radius of the horizon
up to a multiplicative constant. This does not work for more general black
holes such as the Kerr and Reissner-Nordstr\"om solutions. Expounding on the
details of how it fails to work nevertheless uncovers interesting connections
with the "spring constant" of black holes and with black hole thermodynamics.
